newsitem.title: USA: Brazil to reap $24 bln in '97-'98 from asset sales.
newsitem.headline: Brazil to reap $24 bln in '97-'98 from asset sales.

text.p: Brazil will probably reap about $12 billion from the sale of federal and state enterprises this year, and another $12 billion from further privatizations in 1998, said an official said Tuesday.

Jose Pio Borges, vice president of Brazil's National Development Bank (BNDES), forecast that around $10 billion per year would be raised from sell-offs in federal firms and about $2 billion from state enterprises.
Borges forecast that the government would complete the privatization of mining giant CVRD by November.
He estimated the government would garner about $1.8 billion from the selling the final 31.5 percent of shares, the third stage of the privatization process.
Last month, Brazil garnered $3.2 billion from the sale of a controlling bloc of CVRD to a core group of investors.

"It set a standard for how the privatizations will be handled," Borges said. "Having a management group is extremely important, because it adds value to the shareholders and to the IPO that will follow."

He said Brazil would next turn its attention to selling FURNAS, a power generating company; TECON, the container terminal at the port of Santos; TELESP, Sao Paolo's state telecommunications firm and FEPASA, the Sao Paolo railroad enterprise.
Borges spoke to investors at the Americas Society here.
